snippet: Two-thirds of those polled said they were hopeful about the next four years with Bill de Blasio as mayor, and most endorsed a plan to tax wealthy New Yorkers to pay for prekindergarten.
abstract: Quinnipiac University poll shows that, two weeks into new administration, New York City voters are highly optimistic about Mayor Bill de Blasio; two-thirds of those polled said they were hopeful about next four years, and most endorsed plan to tax wealthy New Yorkers to pay for prekindergarten.
lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of those polled said they were hopeful about the next four years with Bill de Blasio as mayor, and most endorsed a plan to tax wealthy New Yorkers to pay for prekindergarten.

headline.main: Most New York Voters Are Optimistic About the Mayor, a Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Most New York Voters Are Optimistic About the Mayor, a Poll Finds
